ygData.subject: Re: leaving?
ygData.msgSnippet: ... I ve done this before with my Enchanter.  It s loads of fun.  I used to put a stone and a gold bar on a mob, and then combine them for who ever brings them
ygData.messageBody:
Bob wrote:

> From: Bob <vampyre@...>
>
> I have something i want to try some time. I want to put an item on a bat
> and then tell all the newbies, ro go find it. Who ever brings me the item
> will get a reward. Myabe a tentacle whip for the fighter typs or my water
> crystal staff for the casters. Ot could be fun. The other night I was
> bored and was going through teh Najena dungeon arming the skels with all the
> old rusty weapond I had found earler. I even gave one a tentacle whip to
> see if hed use it.. He did and it looked cool. I killed that one to get my
> whip back

I've done this before with my Enchanter. It's loads of fun. I used to put a
stone and a gold bar on a mob, and then combine them for who ever brings them
back. My only suggestion would be to put an odd (but common) item on a newbie
critter and state the ground rules up front (ie Nobody over Level 4 can
particpate) that way a wandering level 20 won't nuke everything in sight, spoil
your fun, and sell the tenticle whip.
